item.title: Report X-2024072500
item.description:
Report X-2024072500

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: ENGLEWOOD
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 7/30/2024 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 3700637 at the station location in Englewood, reporting a dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of one plastic jug packaged in a FedEx padded pack. The commidity was discovered leaking from the closure, resulting in spillage that compromised the outer labeling. Based off the product name, Dangerous Goods Administration located an online safety data sheet, idnetifying the commodity as UN 3082 Environmentally hazardous substance, n.o.s.; however, the shipment was not properly packaged in strong rigid outer packaging, which voided the use of Special Provision A197. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024080111
item.description:
Report E-2024080111

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-12T15:14:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: FREDERICK
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: After loading hazardous waste at the shipper's location, the Veolia operator closed the pneumatic internal valve of the tanker and proceeded to disconnect the PTO hydraulic lines when it was noticed that a puddle was forming at the back of the tanker. The Veolia operator proceeded to close the manual valve to stop the release. The generators spill response team was notified. Mechanical evaluation of the tanker revealed that debris had caused the valve stem to seize and prevent the valve from fully closing. The Veolia operator also reported that he was distracted at the end of the loading process and failed to close the secondary manual valve or place a cap on the hose.

item.title: Report X-2024080261
item.description:
Report X-2024080261

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-08T15:13:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-28
  • City: DENVER
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment is a multipiece of 2 packages. Second Trk# 777626285836. The box came open during sort operations due to failure of the tape used to secure the outer packaging. Both boxes were opened and revealed a 50 lb/25 kg paper bag (UN5M2) inside each box, marked and labelled as UN 3077 Enviromentally Hazardous Substance Solid (Zinc Oxide). NO RELEASE. Both packages are being held for FAA investigation.
